Hello! I am a doctoral student in the [Cognition and Decision Lab](https://sites.bu.edu/cdlab/) at Boston University.

My research is concerned with decision-making in the context of &shy;human [information behavior](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_behavior), which I approach from the perspective of computational cognitive neuroscience. This primarily includes &shy;[information seeking](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_seeking) and exploration, two kinds of behavior which are influenced by &shy;curiosity, uncertainty, model-based learning, and valuation processes. &shy;On a broader scale, I am particularly interested how these aspects of individual psychology impact [social epistemology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_epistemology) and the acquisition of knowledge as a human [social endeavor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sociology_of_scientific_knowledge).

I also am an avid evangelist for the open source movement, contributing to Wikipedia and to software tools in the social sciences.
